Java.info: My favorite language and the one I most often work with. I like it for its consistency and stability.

JavaScript.info: Like to work with it as it is very flexible, sometimes wired and funny.

Python.info: I sometimes used it to quickly write some extension (e.g. for mercurial or skype) - nice to quickly prototype something

JEE.info: I'm not a fan of the standard as it is often overcomplicated or wrongly designed (e.g. JAAS)

Jboss-Wildfly.info: It's not my choice java web server but I was often working with it

Dagger.info: Small and sharp, I also use it in small java web apps - for which Spring IOC is to heavy
